intro: Medinilla kemulensis, commonly known as the Kemulensis Medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with glossy, dark green leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters, making it a popular ornamental plant. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
